entry.tran: 残羹剩饭；剩菜；吃剩的食物
entry.def: You can refer to food that has not been eaten after a meal as leftovers .

example.ex: The only food I ever got was the family's leftovers.
example.tran: 我所得到的唯一食物就是这家人的残羹剩饭。

entry.def: You use leftover to describe an amount of something that remains after the rest of it has been used or eaten.

example.ex: Leftover chicken makes a wonderful salad.
example.tran: 剩下的鸡肉可做成一盘美味色拉。

entry.def: If you say that something is a leftover from a past period of time, you mean that it has its origin there and still exists even though most other things connected to that time have disappeared.

example.ex: ...a leftover from the time our planet was first formed...
example.tran: 我们这个星球形成之初的遗迹

example.ex: He dragged a foot when he walked, a leftover from polio.
example.tran: 他走路时一瘸一拐的，那是小儿麻痹的后遗症。

means.word_mean: 1. a small part or portion that remains after the main part no longer exists

sentences.sentence: "she had a little money left over so she went to a movie"

means.word_mean: 2. uneaten and saved for eating later;

sentences.sentence: "leftover food served at a later meal"
